info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 11:51PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Gusty winds and brief heavy rain will impact portions of southeastern Judith Basin and Fergus Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1149 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and some embedded thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles south of Denton to 22 miles south of Lewistown. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and brief downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Hobson, Moore, Grass Range, Roy, Fergus, Forestgrove, Moccasin, Ackley Lake State Park, Glengarry, Garneill, Danvers, Giltedge, Hilger, Heath, Christina, Buffalo and Benchland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Localized heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
